name: Avoid empty catch blocks (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all the artifacts containing empty catch blocks.
In a Try and Catch statement, Catch blocks should have code to handle the thrown exception or at least comments denoting why the exception was not handled.
output:
This report lists all artifacts containing an empty catch block.

This QR provides the following information:
Artifact full name.
rationale:
An empty catch block defeats the purpose of exceptions.
With empty catch block, when an exception occurs, nothing happens and the program may fail because subsequent processing may rely on the result of exception causing statements. If exception cannot or should not be handled for concrete reason, empty catch block should have at least explanation of why.
Since the reason for the issue (the type of the exception and potential embedded message) are not known, it will require more time to fix the issue.
remediation: Exception should be handled or at least contain a comment explaining concrete reason for not handling the exception.
remediationSample:
<?php
try {
      $fileHandle = fopen("my_file.csv", "r");
      if(false === $fileHandle) { 
         throw new Exception('Could not open CSV file!'); 
      }
   } 
   catch (RuntimeException $ex) 
   {
      // violation removed with comment: we should handle the exception properly 
   } catch (Exception $e)
   { 
      echo $e->getMessage(); 
   }
?>

technicalCriteria.name: Programming Practices - Error and Exception Handling

qualityStandards.name: Empty Exception Block
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid improper responses to unusual and unexpected situations

Consequence
Software without consistent and complete handling of errors and exceptions makes it impossible to accurately identify and adequately respond to unusual and unexpected situations.

Measure Element
Number of instances where an exception handling block (such as Catch and Finally blocks) of the named callable and method control elements does not contain any other control element

qualityStandards.name: Detection of Error Condition Without Action
qualityStandards.description: The software detects a specific error, but takes no actions to handle the error.

qualityStandards.name: Unchecked Error Condition
qualityStandards.description: Ignoring exceptions and other error conditions may allow an attacker to induce unexpected behavior unnoticed.
